author: Courtney McBride
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth ramped up his attack on Senator Mark Kelly, taking to social media to deride him for purportedly displaying his uniform medals incorrectly a day after a probe into the Arizona Democrat was announced.
title: Hegseth Ramps Up Attacks on Kelly Over Unlawful Orders Video

author: Sohee Kim, Nectar Gan
description: Earlier this month, fans packed a Guangzhou cinema to see Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – Infinity Castle, helping to make the animated feature China’s top-grossing foreign film of the year. Some even came in cosplay, excited to be part of a cultural phenomenon that’s smashing box office records around the world.
title: Japan-China Spat Clouds Anime Boom’s Momentum in China

author: K Oanh Ha, Yang Yang
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast: Japan’s new prime minister recently raised the issue of support for Taiwan — and now China is retaliating economically.
title: Why China Is Reducing Flights, Upping Retaliation Against Japan

author: Enda Curran
description: Many in the US are confronting slow income growth and a soft job market.
title: As Holidays Approach, There’s Little Cheer for Consumers

author: Linda Poon
description: The leader of the nation’s capital is stepping down at a time when President Donald Trump is seeking to leave his stamp on the city.
title: DC Mayor Bowser Won’t Seek Reelection in 2026

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The US Navy is cutting back its orders for a new class of guided-missile frigate that’s been beset by delays, shifting away from a vessel that President Donald Trump once touted as “the most beautiful.”
title: Navy Cuts Orders for Frigate Trump Once Touted as ‘Beautiful’

author: Kate Sullivan
description: The White House denied that Donald Trump was considering removing FBI Director Kash Patel following a report that the president is weighing his ouster amid a string of controversies.
title: White House Denies Trump Considering Ouster of FBI’s Patel

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The search for the next leader of the United Nations has officially begun.
title: UN Kicks Off Race for Next Leader With Call for Candidates

author: Erik Larson
description: The Trump administration was sued by a group of states over changes to a federal housing-assistance program that allegedly put $3 billion in funding at risk and could force 170,000 people onto the streets.
title: Trump Administration Sued by States Over Homelessness Funds

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: The following is a transcript of an Oct. 29 phone call between Yuri Ushakov, Vladimir Putin’s most senior foreign-policy adviser, and Kirill Dmitriev, an economic adviser to the Russian president.
title: Putin Advisers Discuss Plans for Dealing With Trump: Transcript

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: The following is a transcript of an Oct. 14 phone call lasting just over 5 minutes between Steve Witkoff, Donald Trump’s special envoy for peace missions, and Yuri Ushakov, Vladimir Putin’s most senior foreign-policy adviser.
title: Witkoff Discusses Ukraine Plans With Key Putin Aide: Transcript

author: Flavia Krause-Jackson
description: US presidential envoy Steve Witkoff, fresh from the triumph of the Gaza peace deal, held a phone call last month with a senior Kremlin official to suggest they work together on a similar plan for Ukraine — and that Vladimir Putin should raise it with Donald Trump.
title: Witkoff Advised Russia on How to Pitch Ukraine Plan to Trump

author: Caitlin Reilly, Emily Birnbaum
description: Democratic lawmakers who publicly urged the intelligence community and military members to disobey unlawful orders said they’re facing an FBI inquiry following President Donald Trump’s call for them to be tried for sedition.
title: Veteran Democrats Who Defied Trump Say They’re Under FBI Probe

author: Zoe Tillman, Miles J. Herszenhorn
description: Representative Eric Swalwell, a California Democrat who has been a frequent critic of Donald Trump, filed a lawsuit on Tuesday claiming Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte abused his power to retaliate against one of the president’s political opponents.
title: Swalwell Claims Pulte Abused Power to Target Trump Critics

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: A Brazilian Supreme Court judge ordered Jair Bolsonaro to begin serving his 27-year sentence behind bars, cementing a dramatic downfall for the former president who was convicted of plotting a coup after his 2022 election defeat.
title: Bolsonaro Ordered to Begin 27-Year Sentence Behind Bars

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa expects to be notified by the US that it will be excluded from participating in Group of 20 meetings during its presidency, according to people familiar with the matter, marking a further deterioration in ties between the two countries.
title: South Africa Expects US to Exclude It From G-20 Talks Next Year

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Outgoing New York Mayor Eric Adams is racing to fill key positions before Zohran Mamdani takes office, including on the powerful Rent Guidelines Board, which could undermine the incoming mayor’s pledge to freeze rents on more than 1 million stabilized apartments.
title: NYC’s Adams Pushes Rent Board Changes Before Mamdani Freeze Bid

author: Saleha Mohsin, Josh Wingrove, Nancy Cook, Joshua Green
description: White House National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett is seen by advisers and allies of President Donald Trump as the frontrunner to be the next Federal Reserve chair, according to people familiar with the matter, as the search for a new central bank leader enters its final weeks.
title: Hassett Emerges as Frontrunner in Trump Fed Chair Audition

author: Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz asked German business leaders for patience to allow measures enacted by his ruling coalition to revive growth time to take effect.
title: Merz Asks Corporate Germany for Patience With Economic Reforms

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The British Army has paused the use of its General Dynamics UK Ltd. Ajax armored vehicles and will investigate how more than 30 soldiers were hurt while riding in them during an exercise last weekend.
title: UK Pauses Use of Ajax Armored Vehicles After Soldiers Injured

author: Jan Bratanic, Jasmina Kuzmanovic
description: Slovenia thwarted a Croat government agency’s attempt to take over the Ljubljana Stock Exchange.
title: Slovenia Rejects Croatia’s Bid to Buy Ljubljana Stock Exchange

author: Myles Miller, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The Trump administration plans to review the cases of all refugees resettled under President Joe Biden and freeze their green card applications, the latest clampdown on legal migration to the US.
title: Trump to Review Refugees Admitted Under Biden in New Crackdown

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s defense chief said the NATO member state will soon be able to deploy a US-supplied anti-drone system to thwart a rising number of airspace breaches by Russia.
title: US Anti-Drone System to Help Romania Deter Russian Incursions

author: Dorothy Ma
description: The UK government’s plan to ban reselling tickets above face value is likely music to the ears of concert-goers and a slam dunk for sports fans. For investors in Vivid Seats Inc. — a marketplace for online scalpers — it’s the latest reason to sell off its debt.
title: Ticket Reseller’s Loan Swoons After UK Touts Plan to Cap Prices

author: Mathieu Dion
description: Quebec’s finance minister revised the province’s deficit and borrowing downward, and will introduce tax breaks for workers and certain industries affected by US tariffs.
title: Quebec Cuts Deficit Forecast, Alleviates Tax Burden

author: Kati Pohjanpalo, Jorge Valero
description: The European Union is preparing to add Finland to the list of member states in breach of its fiscal rules after the government in Helsinki failed to rein in a shortfall in public finances.
title: EU Adds Finland to List of Nations Breaking Its Fiscal Rules

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said there may be as many as four meetings between US President Donald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping next year as both sides look to keep in place a fragile trade truce.
title: Bessent Says Trump and Xi May Meet Four Times Next Year

author: Piotr Skolimowski
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said talks with the US about a peace plan were continuing following a report suggesting that Kyiv agreed to the terms of a potential deal to end Russia’s full-scale invasion.
title: Zelenskiy Says Peace Talks With US Continue After Deal Report

author: Julian Lee
description: Shipments fell by 530,000 barrels a day since latest US sanctions were announced
title: Russian Oil Flows Extend Slide With Prices Retreating Again Too

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungarian opposition leader Peter Magyar said the country’s central bank has dropped an investigation into his stock market trades from 2023.
title: Hungary’s Magyar Says Central Bank Drops Insider Trading Probe

author: Anuradha Raghu
description: A senior aide to Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim has resigned following controversy over a support letter for a hospital project that led to mounting pressure on the premier to step up his commitment in tackling graft.
title: Malaysia PM Anwar’s Senior Aide Resigns After Letter Controversy

author: Zosia Wanat, Wojciech Moskwa
description: Poland’s deputy prime minister said he expects Russia to escalate its sabotage activities in the country following an explosion on a busy rail route to Ukraine for which authorities blame Moscow.
title: Poland Expects Russia to Escalate Sabotage After Rail Explosion

author: Antony Sguazzin, Helen Nyambura
description: The International Criminal Court in the Hague has been asked to investigate alleged mass killings during a crackdown on post-election protests in Tanzania last month.
title: ICC Urged to Probe Alleged Mass Killing During Tanzania Election

author: Will Standring, Ellen Milligan
description: The UK will allow Mayor of London Sadiq Khan and other local leaders to impose a “tourist tax” on overnight stays in English cities.
title: Reeves Budget to Embrace Tourist Tax for Cities Including London

author: Augusta Saraiva, Travis Waldron
description: Nemesis Lula polls better than anyone the right might field.
title: Trump of the Tropics Confounds Brazil’s Right

author: Nectar Gan, Colum Murphy, Lucille Liu
description: When Xi Jinping and Donald Trump sat down in South Korea last month to discuss a pause in their trade war, Taiwan surprisingly didn’t come up. Now the biggest flashpoint between the US and China is firmly back on the agenda.
title: Xi Puts Biggest US-China Flashpoint Back on Agenda in Trump Call

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The US Space Force awarded multiple small contracts to develop prototypes for space-based interceptors, looking for progress with a technology that has yet to be proven but forms a crucial part of President Donald Trump’s Golden Dome missile-defense umbrella.
title: Space Force Awards Secret Contracts For Golden Dome Interceptors

author: William Horobin
description: France’s Socialist Party leader Olivier Faure said it will be possible for parliament to overcome divisions to find a compromise on the 2026 budget.
title: French Socialist Head Says Agreement Is Possible on 2026 Budget

author: Alberto Nardelli, Olesia Safronova
description: A US official was due to meet a Russian delegation in Abu Dhabi as President Donald Trump cited progress on his peace proposal and Moscow and Ukraine traded airstrikes overnight.
title: US to Meet Russians in Abu Dhabi as Moscow and Kyiv Trade Fire

author: Natalia Drozdiak
description: As diplomats wrestle with core elements of peace in Ukraine, one element of the draft deal has gone largely overlooked: sweeteners based on an imagined blossoming of US-Russia business.
title: In Trump-Putin Peace Gambit, Both Sides Bet on Lure of Business

author: Benjamin Stupples
description: A group of UK lawmakers is calling for Prime Minister Keir Starmer to introduce a new visa to help attract wealthy foreigners as well-heeled residents continue to flee the nation amid tax hikes.
title: UK Lawmakers Call for New Investor Visa as Wealth Exodus Deepens

author: Danny Lee, K Oanh Ha
description: The Chinese government has instructed the country’s airlines to reduce the number of flights to Japan through March 2026, according to people familiar with the matter, signaling Beijing is braced for a protracted spat between the two nations.
title: China Asks Airlines to Extend Japan Flight Cuts Until March 2026

author: Leen Al-Rashdan, Christine Burke
description: Work has started on new alcohol stores in two of Saudi Arabia’s main cities to serve some non-Muslim customers, the latest step in the country’s efforts to loosen social restrictions.
title: New Alcohol Stores to Open in Saudi Arabia for Some Non-Muslims

author: Erica Yokoyama, Akemi Terukina
description: The leader of Japan’s largest labor union group urged Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s government to do more to fight inflation to help ensure that workers’ wage gains outpace increases in the costs of living.
title: Japan’s Union Head Urges Takaichi to Step Up Inflation Fight

author: Dan Strumpf, Baiju Kalesh
description: India and France have deepened defense cooperation with a pact to jointly produce an air-to-ground weapon, a move aligned with New Delhi’s broader push for self-reliance in advanced military technology.
title: India to Make Air-to-Ground Weapon at Home with France’s Safran

author: Kamran Haider
description: Pakistan’s forces carried out strikes in eastern Afghanistan that killed at least 10 people, the Taliban said, signaling renewed border tension after talks to end clashes collapsed.
title: Taliban Says Pakistani Strikes in Eastern Afghanistan Kill 10

author: Michael Cohen
description: South Africa’s ruling alliance is unlikely to see out its current five-year term, with internal party dynamics set to test its cohesion, a senior politician who helped negotiate the coalition’s operating framework has warned.
title: South Africa’s Ruling Alliance Unlikely to Last, DA’s Zille Says

author: Khine Lin Kyaw
description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko will soon visit Myanmar, his first trip to the country and the first by a European leader since the military seized power in 2021.
title: Lukashenko Planning Rare Visit to Junta-Ruled Myanmar

author: Cindy Wang, Yian Lee
description: Taiwan welcomed President Donald Trump’s decision not to publicly reference the island after his call with Chinese leader Xi Jinping, describing it as the “best result” for Taipei.
title: Taiwan Pleased Trump Didn’t Mention Island in Readout of Xi Call

author: Alastair Gale, Sarah Hilton
description: In a letter to the United Nations, Japan criticized an earlier missive from China as mis-representing the nature of remarks Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi made on Taiwan, saying Beijing’s letter was “inconsistent with the facts and unsubstantiated.”
title: Japan Slams China Letter to UN as ‘Erroneous’ in Its Own Missive

author: Ryotaro Nakamaru
description: Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said she spoke with US President Donald Trump at his request, and that he briefed her on his phone call with Chinese President Xi Jinping and the latest state of US-China relations.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Says Trump Briefed Her on Call With China’s Xi

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Russia launched a combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine, concentrated heavily on the capital Kyiv, just hours after President Donald Trump struck a positive tone on prospects for a ceasefire deal.
title: Russia Bombards Kyiv Hours After Trump Voices Hope for Ukraine Deal

author: Thomas Seal
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney and Alberta Premier Danielle Smith have agreed to the broad terms of a deal that would support a new oil pipeline to Canada’s west coast, the Canadian Broadcasting Corp. reported Monday.
title: Canada Agrees to Deal That Paves Way for New Oil Pipeline, CBC Says
